column4: The 64 10.10 installation fails at random points for me, is there any way to find out why?
md5checksum?
I've checked the installation media, reburnt the cd, burnt the dvd, and the installation simply fails by rebooting
hmmm. what hardware?
amilo 3540
laptop
tried installing with setting any kernel options?
parameters*
intel core 2 duo p8600...
latest ubuntu?
no, I haven't, but it is strange that it just fails without warning at random points of the installation
have you tried isntalling 9 or even 8?
hm, check your harddisc integrity to be shure, try another iso
I have tried several isos for 10.10
well both the cd and the dvd anyway
and checked the md5 sum
why not install .04 and then upgrade if its working?
are you doing graphical installer?
because upgrades are iffy?
you can try if you don't have any other way...
I rather stick with the 32-bit version of ubuntu if that's the case, tbqh
